page.title: 02MY VILLAGE by Tom Clegg
page.content: Crawshawbooth is a good place to walk in the countryside.Once ortwice a week I go on a walk with my dog.I live on Goodshaw Lane opposite a church, called St.Mary's and All Saints. My house used to be a pub called the White Horse.Near my house is a stream and when I go for walks I normally walk down by the stream. In the village thers is a post office a fish and chip shop,a newsagents,a doctors,and a chemists. I go to Crawshawbooth C.P.School which is on Burnley Road. From my bedroom window I can see some of the houses on the next estate up at Loveclough.Next to me there is a farm. The farmer keeps hens,cows,some sheep and a goat. There are some flats quite near to the church,which are mainly occupied by old aged pensioners.
